intro: Pseudobarleria variabilis var. viridescens, commonly known as the greenleaf pseudobarleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, often arranged in spikes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage.
